moves.1... e5: i actually wanted a king's gambit i have so little experience from the black side.
moves.5. Qd1: black has just won the initiative.
moves.5... d5 6. c3: and he lost it as well.
moves.6... Ne6 7. f3: he still has it since he is developed 2 pieces to whites none
moves.8... Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Qe7: this actually blunders and traps my bishop but i relized it after wards so i started thinking about after the bishop is gone ill make him pay for taking it.
moves.10. a3 Bc5: forcing him to make all the moves required to kill it
moves.11... Bd7: its all yours poison and all.
moves.14. Qe2 Nfd7: moving aside to make room for the queen
moves.15. Nh3: a very good insight i thought
moves.16. Qf2 Qh6: after the queen blocked i was planning on f4 but the knight was a nice insight
moves.17. Bd2: attacking her again hoping to get her away, but also opening the door
moves.18... Qb3: attacking the d3 pawn which has a queen fork attached to it
moves.19. O-O: i thought he would but i do not think it matters
moves.22. Bg5: a rook for a rook and a bishop, hmmm must i even think?
moves.25. Ng5 Qxd3: time to start the second half of my plan
moves.26. Nxf7 Rf8: gotta tango with this knight some to get in the right place.
moves.31. Rd1 Nh5: good now get him to f4 and all is mine
moves.32... Rh7: keeps the pressure and continues the plan
moves.33. Nxe5: you can have the pawn, i also notice th attack on my queen by i see that he will not get the move to take her as i am about to enforce mate.
moves.33... Neg3+: not the other knight for the other knight yets him squeak out this one works perfectly
moves.34... Nxg3+: this is a nice ened to this game
moves.35... Rh1#: like i said, he did not get the move to take my queen as his game is now over.
